intro: Microlicia doryphylla var. ovata, commonly known as the oval-leaved microlicia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant features ovate, glossy leaves that are often arranged in opposite pairs along the stems. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Its botanical significance lies in its unique morphology and ecological role within its native habitat.
